text: wait...I thought we sorted out that emmet's is a real place?
It is, though the popup bar could take place at the real Emmets or another location
got it...this is what I get for not staying up to date...as long as I get "credit" for this one I'm cool either way :wink:
haha
if it gets pulled off, it’d be super awesome, and hilarious.
I think this one would need more people to try to get it sorted but it's totally doable...the best part is if we get multiple groups running multiple emmet's around town
well if you scroll up <@UD53A9UUR> had some somewhat promising  results discussing it with his company
I think ultimately efforts should be focused on 1 emmets, way easier to pull off than a bunch all over.

If the people at Inbound would be cool enough, we could probably create an area on the floor called "Emmet's" and maybe that's where we can have agency developers ready to help out inbounders with anything HubSpot related. Similar to their support area
would be really cool but probably super expensive to get the sponsorship of that
yeaaa lol
would be a funny/clever idea though to have it be like a genius bar(third party devs giving consultation) but with actual alcohol being served too
that would be amazing

Yea, that was my thought, it would be all the devs in the community helping people out. We could all wear the same thing like a "Emmet's @ Inbound" shirt, and we would just be helping people with their HS issues. Then at the end, if they want, we could give them our business card or something but it wouldn't be directed as somewhere to push partner brands with marketing, the main focus would be helping people with their HS issues and building a relationship that way, then if they want to extend that relations, totally up to them
<@U22PKFRU5>!!
like i know they usually have that one bar near the dev area thats open, if they'd let us name that bar setup "Emmet's @ Inbound" that would be cool
maybe a `/` <emmet’s/> might be slightly more geeky and obvious. but I like it
lolz. This would be gold
Ah yes, the `/` would def make it better
The way my agency seems to be leaning is having a booth and kinda following what <@U2H3TT8F2> said above. We would serve whiskey and beer that is made in beacon
I think having a geek desk is an amazing idea, though. If I can convince my team to sponsor it, would that be of interest?
I think so. I'd volunteer my time. Might make sense if it was done this way to get multiple companies to sponsor it.
I'd def volunteer my time as well
For sure. I know my company loves the Emmet's idea. And they seem to be willing to put down some cash for it. Just about the presentation ;)
